from the stacktrace i see that SelectionDispatchAction.getShell returned null
the javadoc says it's not possible
from code i of SelectionDispatchAction i see that it was 

IWorkbenchSite.getShell that returned the null (which was also against javadoc)

i will need steps to reproduce this

Dominic, do you remember how you performed the move that failed here?

I do not have any specific steps that I can remember triggering the problem. I 
know that eventually, Eclipse will stop opening files.

I will try to provide some information.

First, I have not had Eclipse installed long when the problem happened. It was 
installed on Mandrake Linux 9.0, if it matters, but since it's Java, it 
shouldn't.

I have only seen it happen at times when I momentarily stop working, and then 
try to open another file. Eclipse will seem to freeze, then it will open no 
more files. Usually, I am working with another application and turn back to 
this. Galeon most often.

It does not seem to trigger on any specific number of file opens. On my home 
system, I only had a few dozen Java files for a single project I was working 
on, and it stopped working. On my laptop, I had dozens of projects each with a 
dozen files, working for more than 10 hours going back and forth from Galeon 
to Eclipse, and the bug didn't happen till the next day.

The only way I have been able to fix the bug was to remove the Eclipse 
directory and reinstall. It has happened 3 times. Twice with the version just 
prior to RC1, and once with RC1.

I have one plug-in installed, Jalopy 0.2.6. I use it heavily.

I cannot think of anything more specific. If you have more questions, I will 
try to answer them. I know how hard it is to trace bugs when you don't know 
how they happened.

One more thing of note, I didn't think about it before.

When I run Eclipse, it puts all kinds of errors on the console that are not in
the error log.

CRITICAL: file crux_draw.c line 2190 (draw_focus) assertion 'width < 32768' failed.

I get these all the time.

Today, I also got a

WARNING: Invalid UTF-8 String passed to pango_layout_set_text().

The second one prevented my from changing fonts, so I don't think it is related.
I don't know what the first one means, but it comes up hundreds of times when
I'm running Eclipse, but only on the console...

i'm unable to reproduce it or infer from code what happened (i verified that 
jdt ui cannot be resposible for the null returned)

i will close this for now
please reopen if you have more insight about  how to reproduce the assertion 
failure

thanks
